channel.title: RSCDaemon v25 (the one click RSC)
channel.description:
Hi, I am new to servers and had a couple of questions. One: Is the "One-Click RSC" even capable of getting online? Two: How? I think I port forwarded, just need a point in the right direction please.
Thank you for your time,
Steven.

item.title: RSCDaemon v25 (the one click RSC)
item.dc:creator: @bamboozola bamboozola
item.description:
@bamboozola wrote:

[quote=“forgez, post:13, topic:360583”][quote author=bamboozola link=topic=456898.msg3344576#msg3344576 date=1284742069]
Well easyrsc is better for beginners, both rscd and easyrsc require port forwarding if your going to host it from your comp if you get a vps or a dedi no need to port forward. i myself like easyrsc
I’d recommend using easyrsc untill you get to know how it works etc
[/quote]

Ok, if there is no real difference then I will use easyrsc now Will try to make some expirience and understandings. Thank you![/quote]Np

Read full topic

@forgez wrote:

bamboozola:

found this tutorial http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,309101.0.html

oh, its nice will add it to fav.

Whats real difference between version with database and EasyRSC? Only bandwitch of server and customization of resourses, I mean if you have database based server it would need low resourses and will give you advance without high loading of computer resourses? Because as I understood you can make in that case both servers one by classic with database and another just with port forwarding.

item.title: RSCDaemon v25 (the one click RSC)
item.dc:creator: @forgez forgez
item.description:
@forgez wrote:

deadheart:

Nope, the bat files are the only reason it runs. I’d suggest getting yourself an older computer, from 2000-2005 in age, and using that to set up the server at your own home. Transfer your domain name to no-ip.net I do believe the site it, and run your private server off of that. That’s how I do it. If you use no-ip, you can even use your domain name instead of an IP address to connect to it (this is especially useful for those of us who have dynamic IP addresses).

ye I understood in prev message. maybe I will do something like that, need to check customizing of world and interest. Because I’ve play rs when it wasnt called classic (whew what the name CLASSIC :))) ) and really it’s very interesting for me and my friends now. Just a hobby for myself maybe its good

Read full topic

item.title: RSCDaemon v25 (the one click RSC)
item.dc:creator: @deadheart deadheart
item.description:
@deadheart wrote:

Nope, the bat files are the only reason it runs. I’d suggest getting yourself an older computer, from 2000-2005 in age, and using that to set up the server at your own home. Transfer your domain name to no-ip.net I do believe the site it, and run your private server off of that. That’s how I do it. If you use no-ip, you can even use your domain name instead of an IP address to connect to it (this is especially useful for those of us who have dynamic IP addresses).

Read full topic

item.title: RSCDaemon v25 (the one click RSC)
item.dc:creator: @forgez forgez
item.description:
@forgez wrote:

A web server is for serving web pages. You can’t host a RSC private server on a web server unless you make it handle everything through PHP which isn’t practical, lol

[quote=“deadheart, post:6, topic:360583”]If you’re using a webhost that isn’t your computer, you’re not going to get it to work because the programs have to be running, which also, if they see you running a program AND taking a huge chunk of bandwidth, they’ll shut you down themselves. It’s easier to set up an old computer, set up an account on no-ip.net I do believe it is, and use your own internet to host it, or someone elses if yours is slow.

From what it sounds like you are using a webhost that’s giving you what they consider “dedicated webhosting”, which usually isn’t dedicated for that kind of thing. Dedicated webhosting =/= dedicated server.[/quote]

Thank you guys, I thought that there could be php side simulated without bat files. Okay, I understand anyway thank you for understanding of submission

Read full topic

item.title: RSCDaemon v25 (the one click RSC)
item.dc:creator: @deadheart deadheart
item.description:
@deadheart wrote:

If you’re using a webhost that isn’t your computer, you’re not going to get it to work because the programs have to be running, which also, if they see you running a program AND taking a huge chunk of bandwidth, they’ll shut you down themselves. It’s easier to set up an old computer, set up an account on no-ip.net I do believe it is, and use your own internet to host it, or someone elses if yours is slow.

From what it sounds like you are using a webhost that’s giving you what they consider “dedicated webhosting”, which usually isn’t dedicated for that kind of thing. Dedicated webhosting =/= dedicated server.

Read full topic

item.title: RSCDaemon v25 (the one click RSC)
item.dc:creator: @forgez forgez
item.description:
@forgez wrote:

[quote=“bamboozola, post:2, topic:360583”]- Apeache:
http://www.uniontransit.com/apache/ant/binaries/apache-ant-1.7.0-bin.zip

  • Xampplite:
    http://www.apachefriends.org/download.php?xampplite-win32-1.6.6a.zip

  • Rscd v25 Source
    http://rapidshare.com/files/126396865/Rscd_v25.rar.html

  • Rscd v25 Www Files
    http://rapidshare.com/files/126398705/www.rar.html

  • Rscd .sql Database
    http://rapidshare.com/files/126399021/Rscd.rar.html

You will need all these.[/quote]

Ok, and If I took your files and making it on dedicated web server, not on my computer. With domain and so one. It works. I’ve upload sql in Db and RSCD to it. How to check its working and connect to it? I really use search but it doesnt help me because a lot of topics was with data like use search

item.title: RSCDaemon v25 (the one click RSC)
item.dc:creator: @bamboozola bamboozola
item.description:
@bamboozola wrote:

Yes you use xampp for wwws or you can use (Wampserver) witch is pretty much the same thing… if your going to use xampp put the www files in (ht-docs) if your going to use wamp click on it and press (www directory)

http://www.wampserver.com/download.php (wampserver) download link

Good luck

Steven.
